title: The Best Hairstyles and Tips for Men with Long Hair

steps.title: Slick your hair back with pomade, wax, or gel if you have straight hair.
steps.content: Slick your hair back with pomade, wax, or gel if you have straight hair. Styling straight hair can be easy-peasy as long as you have the right products. Use a brush to pull your clean and dry hair away from your face, starting at the front of your face and moving towards the back. Take a small amount of product and run it through your hair (in the same direction as the brush) to keep it in place. [1] X Research source Pomade work best for guys with thick hair and has a medium hold. [2] X Research source Wax is best for guys with curly hair but has less hold. Gel is best for all hair types and maximum hold but can give a crunchy texture. If you have wavier hair, consider using a paste to hold your curls and style in place.

steps.title: Wear your hair naturally loose and tousled if you have wavy locks.
steps.content: Wear your hair naturally loose and tousled if you have wavy locks. The longer you grow your hair, the more pronounced your waves will be, so part it in the middle and wear it naturally for a low-maintenance style. [3] X Research source Run a small, quarter-sized dollop of mousse through your hair to reduce frizziness without weighing your curls down. Try using a curl-defining cream to enhance your curls and give them more shine.

steps.title: Rock a middle part if you have straight, chin-length hair.
steps.content: Rock a middle part if you have straight, chin-length hair. Who says flat hair has to be boring? A classic middle part can do wonders, especially if you have high cheekbones or a defined jaw. Simply use a comb to part your hair down the middle. Tuck your hair behind your ears, put on a smolder, and you’ll have everyone swooning! Wash your hair with a smoothing shampoo , so your straight locks shine all day long.

steps.title: Slick your hair back if you have an undercut.
steps.content: Slick your hair back if you have an undercut. No matter your hair type, a clean taper or fade paired with a swoopy hairdo can accentuate your handsome features. Simply ask your barber for an undercut along the sides of your head and to keep the length on top. This way, you can brush your hair back to create a retro look. Use a texturizing spray or dry shampoo to add more volume to your hair.

steps.title: Go for chin-length layers if you have curly hair.
steps.content: Go for chin-length layers if you have curly hair. Embrace your natural hair texture by getting a haircut that frames your face and lets your curls bounce. Opt for a messy part and tousle your hair with a bit of sea salt spray, and you have an effortlessly charming look. Scrunch your curls with a curl-defining product to make them more pronounced.

steps.title: Style your hair in dreadlocks or box braids if you have curly, natural hair.
steps.content: Style your hair in dreadlocks or box braids if you have curly, natural hair. Give yourself dreadlocks or do box braids at home, or have your hair professionally done. These twisted styles are extremely versatile and can be worn up or down. Despite popular belief, they need regular maintenance, so only get them if you’re willing to take the time to care for them . [4] X Research source In certain cultures, dreadlocks have a symbolic meaning, so styling them outside a specific culture may be seen as cultural appropriation. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Get a perm
steps.content: Get a perm if you have thick hair. Perms are chemical hair treatments that can give thick hair even more volume and curl without the frizz. The treatment is done in a salon and normally lasts 3 to 6 months. Style these waves with a voluminous fringe or messily tousled. [6] X Research source Rub a small amount of gel or mousse in your hands and scrunch them through your hair to define and hold your new waves in place. Use a moisturizing conditioner to add moisture to your hair after it’s chemically treated.

steps.title: Pull your hair up and out of your face with a ponytail.
steps.content: Pull your hair up and out of your face with a ponytail. If your hair brushes past your shoulders, try putting it in a ponytail for a quick and classic updo. Brush all the tangles out of your hair, and then gather it up to the back of your head. Secure it with a hair elastic , and you’re good to go! [7] X Research source Spritz your hair with hairspray after it’s pulled back to set your hairdo and lessen the chance of fly aways. Tie your ponytail at the top of your head or on the base of your neck—do whatever’s the most comfortable for you.

steps.title: Tie your hair into a man bun for a messy yet swoon-worthy look.
steps.content: Tie your hair into a man bun for a messy yet swoon-worthy look. Man buns are a popular hairstyle for men with long hair because they’re easy to do and effortlessly fashionable. To create a man bun , all you have to do is make a ponytail, twirl the tail around with your finger, and wrap it around the base of the ponytail. Secure everything in place with another hair elastic, and you have a super simple yet hot look. There are multiple ways to make a bun, so experiment with bobby pins and wrapping styles to find what works best for you. Use a small amount of hairspray to help your bun stay in place.

steps.title: Wear half of your hair up and the other half down
steps.content: Wear half of your hair up and the other half down for a relaxed look. Half-ponytails are ideal if you’re going for a styled yet rugged look because of their effortless vibe. Simply brush out your hair, removing any tangles. Then, use your fingers to divide your hair into 2 parts by dragging your fingertips from the top of your ears to the back of your head. Tie the top section of your hair into a ponytail or bun using an elastic. For a cleaner look, part your hair with a comb and slick back the top half. Give your hair a little texture by spritzing it with some sea salt spray .

steps.title: Braid your hair
steps.content: Braid your hair for a strong, secure hairstyle. If you need a hairstyle that’ll stay in place all day long, go for a braid. Brush out your hair, then divide it into 3 even sections. Cross the left section over the middle section, then cross the right section over the middle. Continue crossing until you reach the end of your hair. Secure the finished braid with a rubber band or hair elastic. Try different kinds of braids like the French or fishtail braid until you find something that matches your style and is easy to do.

steps.title: Limit how often you shampoo your hair to keep it healthy.
steps.content: Limit how often you shampoo your hair to keep it healthy. Everyone’s hair is different, and whether or not you shampoo every day or every other day depends on your age, lifestyle, hair length, and hair type. For some, washing their hair less is healthier, whereas others find that washing their hair more is better. [8] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Find a hair washing routine that works for you and stick to it. You may be washing your hair too much if: [9] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source It’s constantly dry. Starts breaking. You have a dry, itchy scalp regularly. Try using dry shampoo in between washes or wearing headbands or bandanas to cleverly hide excess oils.

steps.title: Work with your hair type, not against it.
steps.content: Work with your hair type, not against it. Your hair is unique, so embrace its natural quirks! Opt for hair cuts that follow your natural curls, waves, and cowlicks, and use products made for your hair type and texture. This way, you won’t be fighting against your hair every morning but working with it. For instance, if you have curly hair, use curl-defining creams instead of pomades to style it so your curls don’t flatten. If you have heavy, straight hair, opt for layers to keep your hair from falling into your face. [10] X Research source If you have wavy, frizzy hair, stick with a straight cut or trim so your curls naturally weigh themselves down. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Massage your scalp daily to encourage hair growth.
steps.content: Massage your scalp daily to encourage hair growth. If you want your hair to grow even longer, try giving yourself a scalp massage . Scalp massages have been proven to increase hair growth and thickness in men, so why not give it a try? [12] X Research source Simply massage for 5 minutes every day. [13] X Research source If you’ll be washing your hair after your massage, consider massaging with coconut oil , as this can give your hair extra vitamins and minerals.

steps.title: Get a haircut every 6 to 8 weeks to promote hair growth.
steps.content: Get a haircut every 6 to 8 weeks to promote hair growth. Believe it or not, trimming your hair may help it grow even longer. Long hair can easily become unruly, so opt to get it cut every 6 weeks or so to combat split ends and freshen things up. You may even notice your hair growing faster because of your periodic hair cuts. [14] X Expert Source Arthur Sebastian Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 1 April 2020. Along with this, regular trims can: Prevent split ends. Keep your hair manageable. Minimize dry scalp.

steps.title: Try to blow dry your hair less.
steps.content: Try to blow dry your hair less. Excessive blow drying can dry out your hair, causing it to become brittle. Using heat regularly can also damage your hair follicles, stopping hair growth and lessening shine. Aim to let your hair air dry whenever you can so your hair stays happy and healthy. [15] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you need to blow dry your hair, spray it with a heat protectant beforehand and use the lowest heat setting. This will help protect your hair from the heat and limit the damage.

steps.title: Invest in high-quality grooming items meant for your hair type.
steps.content: Invest in high-quality grooming items meant for your hair type. Using the right materials can make a huge difference when caring for your hair. You don’t need to buy the most expensive products, but pick those designed to help you and your hair’s needs. For example: Purchase a wide-tooth comb or wet brush if you brush your hair while it’s wet, as they can prevent split ends and breakage. [16] X Research source Find shampoo designed for color-treated hair if you dye your hair. [17] X Research source Buy silk pillowcases if you have curlier hair, so it doesn’t frizz up at night. Use cloth-covered hair ties instead of plastic elastics if you have thin or fine hair to avoid breakage.
